responsibilities: Work with autonomous driving dataset for training AD planning modules.
Develop supporting tools for simulation environments to facilitate AD research and development.
Implement, test, and deploy DL-based AD models using Python.
Closely collaborate and interact with other team members and support their research activities.
skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks such as Pytorch and Tensorflow.
Strong grasp of fundamentals: linear algebra, discrete and continuous optimization, supervised and unsupervised learning, generative and discriminative learning.
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on working with autonomous driving (AD) datasets, developing tools for simulation environments, studying academic research, and implementing deep learning (DL) models for AD. The skills required include excellent coding skills in Python, familiarity with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch and TensorFlow, and a strong grasp of machine learning fundamentals, including generative and discriminative learning.

While the job involves deep learning and generative learning, there is no explicit mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The focus is more on autonomous driving and related deep learning models rather than on language models or generative AI technologies specifically.
